contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God called me to be an apostle and chose me to tell people about the gospel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: κλητὸς ἀπόστολος, ἀφωρισμένος εἰς εὐαγγέλιον Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: called to be an apostle and set apart for the gospel of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "he" refers to Jesus Christ. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God declared him with power to be the Son of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τοῦ ὁρισθέντος Υἱοῦ Θεοῦ ἐν δυνάμει
contextId.glQuote: he was declared with power to be the Son of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: God has given Paul the gift of being an apostle. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God caused me to be an apostle. This is a special privilege" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we have received grace and apostleship

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "I am writing this letter to all of you in Rome whom God loves and has chosen to become his people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πᾶσιν τοῖς οὖσιν ἐν Ῥώμῃ, ἀγαπητοῖς Θεοῦ, κλητοῖς ἁγίοις
contextId.glQuote: This letter is to all who are in Rome, the beloved of God, who are called to be holy people

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "May God give you grace and peace" or "May God bless you and give you inner peace" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May grace be to you, and peace

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "I mean that I want us to encourage each other by sharing our experiences of faith in Jesus" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τοῦτο δέ ἐστιν συνπαρακληθῆναι ἐν ὑμῖν, διὰ τῆς ἐν ἀλλήλοις πίστεως, ὑμῶν τε καὶ ἐμοῦ
contextId.glQuote: That is, I long to be mutually encouraged among you, through each other's faith, yours and mine

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "something has always prevented me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but I was hindered until now

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul speaks about the gospel message as if it were an object that God could physically show to people. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God has told us that it is by faith from beginning to end that people become righteous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: δικαιοσύνη ... Θεοῦ ... ἀποκαλύπτεται, ἐκ πίστεως εἰς πίστιν
contextId.glQuote: God's righteousness is revealed from faith to faith

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "as someone has written in the Scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as it has been written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For God shows how angry he is" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For the wrath of God is revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "they can know about God because of what they can plainly see" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ γνωστὸν τοῦ Θεοῦ, φανερόν ἐστιν ἐν αὐτοῖς
contextId.glQuote: that which is known about God is visible to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "because of the things that God has made" or "because people have seen the things that God has made" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: in the things that have been made

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "began to think foolish things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: became foolish in their thoughts

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "They have in them a strong desire for" or "They strongly desire to do deeds of" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They have been filled with

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "Many are constantly envying other people ... Many constantly desire to murder people ... to cause arguments and quarrels among people ... to deceive others ... to speak hatefully about others" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, and evil intentions

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "whom God will accept" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who will be justified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because people have taught you what is right from the law" or "because you have learned from the law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because you have been instructed from the law

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "many Gentiles blaspheme the name of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ ... ὄνομα τοῦ Θεοῦ ... βλασφημεῖται ἐν τοῖς ἔθνεσιν
contextId.glQuote: the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "The Scriptures themselves agree with what I am saying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As it has been written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "This is as the prophets have written in the Scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This is as it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God has made known a way to be right with him without obeying the law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: apart from the law the righteousness of God has been made known

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God considered Abraham as a righteous person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was counted to him as righteousness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one counts what the employer pays him as a gift from the employer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ μισθὸς οὐ λογίζεται κατὰ χάριν
contextId.glQuote: what he is paid is not counted as a gift

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "but as what his employer owes him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but as what is owed

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God considers that person's faith as righteousness" or "God considers that person righteous because of his faith" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: λογίζεται ἡ πίστις αὐτοῦ εἰς δικαιοσύνην
contextId.glQuote: his faith is counted as righteousness

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God considered the faith of Abraham as righteousness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐλογίσθη τῷ Ἀβραὰμ ἡ πίστις εἰς δικαιοσύνην
contextId.glQuote: Faith was counted to Abraham as righteousness

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "This means that God will consider them righteous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰς τὸ ... λογισθῆναι αὐτοῖς τὴν δικαιοσύνην
contextId.glQuote: This means that righteousness will be counted for them

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "just as God said to Abraham" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: according to what he had been told

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "he became stronger in his faith" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was strengthened in faith

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "Therefore God counted Abraham's belief as righteousness" or "Therefore God considered Abraham righteous because Abraham believed him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: διὸ καὶ" ἐλογίσθη αὐτῷ εἰς δικαιοσύνην
contextId.glQuote: Therefore this was also counted to him as righteousness

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "that God counted righteousness to him" or "God considered him righteous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that it was counted for him

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "It was also for our benefit, because God will consider us righteous also if we believe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was written also for us, for whom it will be counted, we who believe

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "whom God gave over to enemies for our trespasses and whom God brought back to life so he could make us right with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὃς παρεδόθη διὰ τὰ παραπτώματα ἡμῶν, καὶ ἠγέρθη διὰ τὴν δικαίωσιν ἡμῶν
contextId.glQuote: who was delivered up for our trespasses and was raised for our justification

contextId.occurrenceNote: The death of the Son of the God has provided eternal forgiveness and made us friends with God, for all who believe in Jesus. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God allowed us to have a peaceful relationship with him because his son died for us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: κατηλλάγημεν τῷ Θεῷ διὰ τοῦ θανάτου τοῦ Υἱοῦ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "now that God has made us his friends again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after having been reconciled

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "many people sinned" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the many were made sinners

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will make many people right with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will the many be made righteous

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "might die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: might be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "sin should no longer enslave us" or "we should no longer be slaves to sin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we should no longer be enslaved to sin

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to raise up is an idiom for causing someone who has died to become alive again. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "We know since God brought Christ back to life after he died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.quote: εἰδότες ὅτι Χριστὸς ἐγερθεὶς ἐκ νεκρῶν
contextId.glQuote: We know that since Christ has been raised from the dead

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "pattern" refers to the way of living that leads to righteousness. The believers change their old way of living to match this new way of living that Christian leaders teach to them. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "the teaching that Christian leaders gave you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: καρδίας, εἰς ὃν παρεδόθητε τύπον διδαχῆς
contextId.glQuote: the pattern of teaching that you were given

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "Christ has freed you from sin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You have been made free from sin

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But now that you have become free from sin and have become God's slaves" or "But now that God has freed you from sin and made you his slaves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: νυνὶ δέ, ἐλευθερωθέντες ἀπὸ τῆς ἁμαρτίας, δουλωθέντες δὲ τῷ Θεῷ
contextId.glQuote: But now that you have been made free from sin and are enslaved to God

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will consider her an adulteress" or "people will call her an adulteress" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she will be called an adulteress

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "you also died to the law when through Christ you died on the cross" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: καὶ ὑμεῖς ἐθανατώθητε τῷ νόμῳ διὰ τοῦ σώματος τοῦ Χριστοῦ
contextId.glQuote: you were also made dead to the law through the body of Christ

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God has released us from the law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we have been released from the law

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the law. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "to the law which held us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to that by which we were held

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "we might fulfill what the law requires" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὸ δικαίωμα τοῦ νόμου πληρωθῇ ἐν ἡμῖν
contextId.glQuote: the requirements of the law might be fulfilled in us

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For all the people whom the Spirit of God leads" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: God will honor Christian believers when he honors Christ. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "that God may glorify us along with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that we may also be glorified with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "I cannot compare the sufferings of this present time with" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I consider that ... are not worthy to be compared with

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will reveal" or "God will make known" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "for the time when God will reveal his children" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὴν ἀποκάλυψιν τῶν υἱῶν τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: for the revealing of the sons of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For God caused what he had created to be unable to achieve what he intended" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῇ γὰρ ματαιότητι, ἡ κτίσις ὑπετάγη
contextId.glQuote: For the creation was subjected to futility

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will save creation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the creation itself will be delivered

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For God saved us because we hoped in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For in this certain hope we were saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "for those whom God chose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for those who are called

contextId.occurrenceNote: God planned from before the beginning of creation to grow those who believe in Jesus, the Son of God, into persons who are like Jesus. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "that he would change them to be like his Son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: συμμόρφους τῆς εἰκόνος τοῦ Υἱοῦ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: to be conformed to the image of his Son

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "I personally would be willing to let God curse me and, keep me apart from Christ forever if that would help my fellow Israelites, my own people group, to believe in Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ηὐχόμην γὰρ ἀνάθεμα εἶναι αὐτὸς, ἐγὼ ἀπὸ τοῦ Χριστοῦ ὑπὲρ τῶν ἀδελφῶν μου, τῶν συγγενῶν μου, κατὰ σάρκα
contextId.glQuote: For I could wish that I myself would be cursed and set apart from Christ for the sake of my brothers, those of my own race according to the flesh

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form to express that God will give a son to Sarah. Alternate translation: "I will give Sarah a son" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a son will be given to Sarah

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "that people might proclaim my name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that my name might be proclaimed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "her" refers to Hosea's wife, Gomer, who represents the nation of Israel. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "I will choose her whom I did not love to be one whom I love" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: her beloved who was not beloved

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul uses the word "saved" in a spiritual sense. If God saves a person, it means that through believing in Jesus' death on the cross, God has forgiven him and rescued him from being punished for his sin. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will save" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will save you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is equivalent to: "Everyone who does not believe will be shamed." The negative is used here for emphasis. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will honor everyone who believes in him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πᾶς ὁ πιστεύων ἐπ’ αὐτῷ οὐ καταισχυνθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: Everyone who believes on him will not be put to shame

contextId.occurrenceNote: Prophets often speak of things in the future as if they have already happened. This emphasizes that the prophecy will certainly come true. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "Even though the Gentile people will not look for me, they will find me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εὑρέθην ἐν τοῖς ἐμὲ μὴ ζητοῦσιν
contextId.glQuote: I was found by those who did not seek me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Thus God will save all Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Thus all Israel will be saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "just as the scriptures record" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: just as it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "Do not let the world tell you what to do and think" or 2) "Do not allow yourself to act and do what the world does." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Do not be conformed

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "but let God change the way you think and behave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀλλὰ μεταμορφοῦσθε τῇ ἀνακαινώσει τοῦ νοός
contextId.glQuote: but be transformed by the renewal of your mind

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "You must love people sincerely and truly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let love be without hypocrisy

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "show affection" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be affectionate

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For someone has written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "And the people who are in authority are there because God put them there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: αἱ δὲ οὖσαι ὑπὸ Θεοῦ τεταγμέναι εἰσίν
contextId.glQuote: The authorities that exist have been appointed by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will judge those who oppose government authority" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who oppose it will receive judgment on themselves

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For someone has written in the Scriptures: 'As" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For it is written, "As

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "people will approve of him" or "people will respect him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: approved by people

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "God will say that the person does wrong if he is not sure if it is right to eat a certain food, but he eats it anyway" or "The person who is not sure if it is right to eat a certain food, but then eats it anyway will have a troubled conscience" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He who doubts is condemned if he eats

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "For in times past, the prophets wrote everything in the Scriptures to teach us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὅσα γὰρ προεγράφη, εἰς τὴν ἡμετέραν διδασκαλίαν ἐγράφη
contextId.glQuote: For whatever was previously written was written for our instruction

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "as someone has written in the Scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul speaks of grace as if it were a physical gift that God had given him. God had appointed Paul and apostle even though he had persecuted believers before he decided to follow Jesus. You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "the grace that God gave me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὴν χάριν τὴν δοθεῖσάν μοι ὑπὸ τοῦ Θεοῦ
contextId.glQuote: the grace given me by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form: Alternative translation: Alternate translation: "These are things that Christ has accomplished through what I have said and done" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These are things done by word and action

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Paul refers to what Isaiah wrote in the scriptures. You can translate this in an active form and make the meaning explicit. Alternate translation: "What is happening is like what Isaiah wrote in the scriptures" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: It is as it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "they also hindered me" or "people also hindered me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was also hindered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God may rescue me from those who are disobedient" or "God may keep those who are disobedient from harming me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I may be rescued from those who are disobedient

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "The apostles know them very well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἵτινές εἰσιν ἐπίσημοι ἐν τοῖς ἀποστόλοις
contextId.glQuote: They are prominent among the apostles

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can translate this in an active form. Alternate translation: "whom the Lord has chosen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: chosen in the Lord
